heading: Tuesday Night
text: Snow, mainly from Vermont eastward, and from Route 2 southward, all tapering off by midnight; another trace to 2 inches north, and 2 to 4 inches south, mainly southeast. Lows from the mid teens to mid 20s, north to south. North to northwest winds 5 to 10 mph, gusting to 20 mph in New Hampshire.

heading: Wednesday
text: Variable clouds. Slight chance of late-day snow showers in the St. Lawrence Valley. Highs in the upper 20s to lower 30s, some mid 20s northeast. Northwest winds 5 to 15 mph in the morning, then diminishing.

heading: Wednesday Night
text: Becoming cloudy. Snow showers likely in the St. Lawrence Valley, a rising chance elsewhere north after midnight. Lows in the teens east of the Green Mountains, 20s west. Light winds in areas east of the Greens, becoming south 10 to 15 mph from the Green Mountains westwards.
